title: Meghan Markle will step out without Prince Harry for a gala at the Royal Albert Hall tonight
text:
The Duchess of Sussex shared a throwback photo of Justin Trudeau hours after he was re-elected as Prime Minister of Canada.

The snap shows Meghan, 38, chatting to Mr Trudeau, 47, at the One Young World summit in Ottowa in 2016.

Then starring in US legal drama Suits, Meghan attended the conference to deliver a speech to a group of global young leaders.

Tonight she will attend the official opening of the 2019 One Young World summit at London's Royal Albert Hall. It marks her first public outing since the explosive ITV documentary was aired on Sunday night.

The Duchess of Sussex shared a throwback photo of Justin Trudeau hours after he was re-elected as Prime Minister of Canada. The snap shows Meghan, 38, chatting to Mr Trudeau, 47, at the One Young World summit in Ottowa in 2016. Meghan will attend the 2019 summit today

Ahead of the appearance tonight, the official Sussex Royal Instagram account shared a post highlighting the Duchess' long-standing relationship with the One Young World (OYW) organisation.

She first spoke at a OYW summit in Dublin in 2014 and returned two years later for the engagement alongside Mr Trudeau.

Spotlight: The engagement marks the royal's first appearance since she revealed she feels 'vulnerable' in an explosive ITV interview that aired on Sunday night, pictured

This year she will attend in her role as vice-president of the Queen's Commonwealth Trust, which is partnering with One Young World to bring 53 young leaders to the summit.

The event is described as a 'global forum for young leaders' and will bring together 2,000 people from more than 190 countries.

The Instagram post read: 'The Duchess of Sussex will attend @OneYoungWorld opening ceremony this evening to continue her support for this amazing collective of global youth ambassadors.'

Meghan first spoke at a OYW summit in Dublin in 2014, when she was still an actress (pictured)

Ahead of the summit, Meghan and Harry's official Sussex Royal Instagram account highlighted the Duchess' longstanding relationship with the global youth leadership organisation

It continued: 'Later this week The Duchess will hold a round table discussion with several of the OYW young leaders to address the issue of gender equity worldwide, and how we can all play our part to reach equality for all.'

Sharing the photo today could also be a subtle congratulatory nod to Mr Trudeau, whom Meghan and Harry have met on several occasions.

Meghan is thought to have befriended Mr Trudeau's wife Sophie - a mutual friend of stylist Jessica Mulroney - while living in Toronto. She was based in the city while filming Suits.
